IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC (THE "FOUNDATION") IS DEDICATED TO GROWING PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO ENSURING THE DETROIT REGION'S ECONOMY IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING IN THE U.S.
IRS990.MissionDesc: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. (THE "FOUNDATION") IS DEDICATED TO GROWING PROGRAMS OR INITIATIVES THAT ARE IMPORTANT TO ENSURING THE DETROIT REGION'S ECONOMY IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING IN THE U.S.
IRS990.Desc: THE DETROIT PROMISE IS THE FOUNDATION'S UMBRELLA SCHOLARSHIP FOR ALL INCOMING COLLEGE STUDENTS, INCLUDING FOUR-YEAR UNIVERSITY STUDENTS FORMALLY ENROLLING THROUGH THE DETROIT COMPACT SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM. THE DETROIT PROMISE IS A FOUNDATION ADMINISTERED PROGRAM FUNDED BY THE MICHIGAN EDUCATION EXCELLENCE FOUNDATION ("MEEF"), A MICHIGAN NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION. UNDER A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH THE MEEF, THE DETROIT PROMISE'S ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITY IS TO PROVIDE A LAST-DOLLAR SCHOLARSHIP FOR DETROIT HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS ENTERING AREA COMMUNITY COLLEGES AND PARTICIPATING FOUR-YEAR UNIVERSITIES. PER STATE OF MICHIGAN STATUTE, THE DPZA IS ALLOCATED A PORTION OF STATE PROPERTY TAXES COLLECTED IN THE CITY OF DETROIT FOR THE EXPRESS PURPOSE OF FUNDING A COLLEGE PROMISE PROGRAM. THE DPZA HAS DESIGNATED THE FOUNDATION AS ITS PARTNER TO ADMINISTER THIS PROGRAM AND USES THE TAX CAPTURE REVENUE TO ALLOCATE FUNDING TO THE FOUNDATION TO FUND THE PROGRAM WITHIN THE STATUTE GUIDELINES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: MICHAUTO IS MICHIGAN'S ONLY AUTOMOTIVE AND MOBILITY CLUSTER ASSOCIATION TO PROTECT, RETAIN, AND GROW MICHIGAN'S SIGNATURE INDUSTRY WHILE ALSO ENSURING THE STATE'S LEADERSHIP IN ADVANCING THE DEVELOPMENT AND MANUFACTURING OF NEXT-GENERATION MOBILITY TECHNOLOGY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION LEADS A COMPREHENSIVE EDUCATION AND TALENT PORTFOLIO OF PROGRAM AND POLICY WORK IN THE STATE. WITH THE GOAL TO INCREASE POSTSECONDARY DEGREE ATTAINMENT IN SOUTHEAST MICHIGAN TO 60% BY 2030, THE CHAMBER'S WORK WILL GROW THE TALENT POOL FOR EMPLOYERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT:THE FOUNDATION'S ECONOMIC PROSPERITY STRATEGY POSITIONS THE DETROIT REGION FOR LONG-TERM GLOBAL COMPETITIVENESS FOR THE NEXT DECADE AND BEYOND. THE WORK IS FUNDED THROUGH CONTRIBUTIONS AND GRANTS FROM CORPORATE DONORS AND PRIVATE PHILANTHROPY. THE STRATEGY IS EXECUTED THROUGH A SERIES OF INITIATIVES ENSURING THE REGION IS EDUCATED, EMPLOYED, HEALTHY, AND LEADING IN NEXT-GENERATION MOBILITY.LEADERSHIP DETROIT:LEADERSHIP DETROIT PROVIDES THE FOUNDATION FOR A LIFELONG COMMITMENT TO LEADERSHIP BY CREATING AWARENESS OF KEY ISSUES THAT AFFECT THE DETROIT REGION AND TO CHALLENGE EMERGING AND EXISTING COMMUNITY LEADERS TO BRING ABOUT POSITIVE CHANGE IN THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INFORMED LEADERSHIP.RACIAL JUSTICE AND ECONOMIC EQUITY:THE FOUNDATION LEVERAGES ITS POSITION AS A COVENER OF BUSINESS TO ENSURE PERVASIVE AND LONG-TERM CHANGE BOTH SOCIETALLY AND ECONOMICALLY. THIS WORK IS ROOTED IN REFLECTIVE FOCUS ON ACCOUNTABILITY INTERNALLY AND EXTERNALLY THROUGH A COMMITMENT TO ENSURING THE REGION'S EQUITABLE FUTURE.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: SENIOR DIRECTOR, ENGAGEMENT AND MEMBERSHIP DEVELOP

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION AND THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER (THE "CHAMBER") HAVE COMMON MANAGEMENT TEAMS. MANAGEMENT HAS A COPY OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE DETERMINATION LETTER INDICATING THAT THE CHAMBER QUALIFIES UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 501(C)(6). MANAGEMENT ANNUALLY REVIEWS THE CHAMBER'S FINANCIAL ACTIVITY TO ASCERTAIN THAT THE CHAMBER CONTINUES TO SATISFY THE PUBLIC SUPPORT TESTS UNDER INTERNAL REVENUE CODE SECTION 509(A)(2).

ANY FUNDS PROVIDED BY THE FOUNDATION TO THE CHAMBER ARE USED BY THE PROGRAMS FOR WHICH THEY ARE INTENDED. ALL PROGRAMS OF BOTH THE FOUNDATION AND THE CHAMBER HAVE THEIR OWN COST CENTERS TO KEEP FINANCIAL ACTIVITY SEGREGATED. THIS ACTIVITY IS MONITORED BY THE ORGANIZATIONS' COMMON MANAGEMENT TEAMS.

THE MEMBERSHIP OF THE FOUNDATION CONSISTS OF THE MEMBERS OF THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVES THE SELECTION OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECOMMENDS POLICIES THAT ARE SUBMITTED TO THE CHAMBER'S EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE FOR APPROVAL. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS DOES NOT VOTE ON OR INSTITUTE ANY POLICY INDEPENDENT OF THE CHAMBER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S MANAGEMENT IS NOT AWARE OF ANY UNRECOGNIZED TAX BENEFITS AS OF JUNE 30, 2022 OR 2023.

FundraiserActivityInfoGrp.ActivityTxt: ADVISES OF POTENTIAL TARGETS TO MEET WITH AND DOLLAR AMOUNT

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GRANT FUNDS ARE RECORDED AND TRACKED USING SEPARATE COST CENTERS IN THE GENERAL LEDGER. THE PROGRAM MANAGER, MONITORS EXPENSES ON A MONTHLY BASIS, WHICH ARE APPROVED BY THE APPROPRIATE EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT TEAM (EMT) MEMBER. GRANT FUNDS PAID OUT ARE DONE SO THROUGH THE NORMAL ACCOUNTS PAYABLE PROCESS, WITH A CHECK REQUEST OR INVOICE (APPROVED BY PROGRAM MANAGER AND EMT MEMBER) SUBMITTED TO ACCOUNTING. INVOICES ARE ENTERED INTO THE ACCOUNTS PAYABLE SYSTEM, THEN APPROVED BY THE CFO OR SR. DIRECTOR, ACCOUNTING. CHECKS OVER $4,000 REQUIRE TWO SIGNATURES. PROGRESS REPORTS ARE SUBMITTED TO FUNDERS TO SHOW ACTUAL EXPENDITURES COMPARED TO THE APPROVED GRANT BUDGET.

THE FOUNDATION ACCRUES BONUS COMPENSATION FOR THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AND OTHER EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT STAFF BASED ON PREDETERMINED PERCENTAGES THAT HAVE BEEN OUTLINED IN THEIR EMPLOYMENT CONTRACTS OR OTHER EMPLOYMENT MEMOS AND APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE FINAL BONUS ELIGIBILITY AND AMOUNT IS BASED ON PERFORMANCE EVALUATIONS AND PERCENTAGES OF GOAL ACHIEVEMENT APPROVED BY THE CEO AND THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. PAYOUT OF ANY PERFORMANCE BONUS IS SUBJECT TO OVERALL CONSOLIDATED ORGANIZATIONAL FINANCIAL PERFORMANCE TO ENSURE SUFFICIENT FUNDS AND IS NOT PAID UNTIL THE FINANCIAL RESULTS OF THE FOUNDATION'S SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER, ARE DETERMINED AT THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. THE BONUSES ARE PAID OUT WITHIN 75 DAYS OF THE END OF THE FISCAL YEAR. FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2023, THE CEO BONUS WAS APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CHAIR TO BE PAID OUT IN JULY 2023. IF THE BOARD APPROVED BUDGETED NET PERFORMANCE RESULTS OF THE CONSOLIDATED CHAMBER WERE NOT MET, THE BONUS AMOUNTS WOULD BE REDUCED OR ELIMINATED SO AS NOT TO CREATE NEGATIVE NET EARNINGS AS COMPARED TO THE BUDGET FOR THE FOUNDATION. BONUS POOLS FOR THE CEO, EXECUTIVE MANAGEMENT TEAM, AND OTHER EMPLOYEES ARE APPROVED BY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. CONSISTS OF 18 PROMINENT BUSINESS LEADERS FROM THE COMMUNITY REPRESENTING A DIVERSITY OF BUSINESS SECTORS. THERE ARE BOARD MEMBERS WHOSE COMPANIES HAVE "ARMS LENGTH" BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS WITH OTHER BOARD MEMBERS' COMPANIES. THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD MEMBERS ARE ALSO IN HIGH DEMAND TO SERVE ON OTHER BOARDS. IT IS NOT UNUSUAL FOR SOME OF THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD MEMBERS TO SIT ON OTHER BOARDS, INCLUDING COMPANIES THAT ARE REPRESENTED ON THE FOUNDATION BOARD.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE VOTING MEMBERS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE THOSE PERSONS THAT CONSTITUTE THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT CPA FIRM AND IS REVIEWED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, THE CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, AND THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS APPOINTED AN AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE, WHICH IS A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE'S PRIMARY FUNCTION IS TO ASSIST THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN FULFILLING ITS OVERSIGHT RESPONSIBILITIES BY REVIEWING THE FINANCIAL INFORMATION WHICH WILL BE PROVIDED TO THE FOUNDATION AND OTHERS, THE SYSTEM OF INTERNAL CONTROLS WHICH MANAGEMENT AND THE BOARD HAVE ESTABLISHED, AND THE AUDIT PROCESS. IN DOING SO, IT IS THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE'S RESPONSIBILITY TO PROVIDE AN OPEN AVENUE OF COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, MANAGEMENT, AND THE FOUNDATION'S EXTERNAL AUDITORS. PRIOR TO SUBMISSION OF THE FORM 990, THE RETURN IS REVIEWED WITH THE CHAIR OF THE AUDIT AND FINANCE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. SHARES ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF WITH ITS SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION, THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER. THE CHAMBER AND ITS COMPENSATION COMMITTEE HAVE AN EXTENSIVE PROCESS TO REVIEW ALL MATTERS OF EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE NOT AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

CONTRACT SERVICES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 3,856,641. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 0. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 0. TOTAL EXPENSES 3,856,641. PROFESSSIONAL FEES: PROGRAM SERVICE EXPENSES 76,006. MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL EXPENSES 76,328. FUNDRAISING EXPENSES 21. TOTAL EXPENSES 152,355.

PRIMARY ACTIVITY - THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER IS A CHAMBER OF COMMERCE AND IS THE SUPPORTED ORGANIZATION OF THE FOUNDATION. MICHIGAN FUTURE, INC'S MISSION IS TO DEVELOP AND ADVANCE A PRACTICAL VISION OF MICHIGAN'S SOCIAL, EDUCATIONAL, AND ECONOMIC FUTURE.

SHARED COSTS - THE DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER AND DETROIT REGIONAL CHAMBER FOUNDATION, INC. SHARE A COMMON OFFICE AND UTILIZE A COMMON PAYROLL SYSTEM, WITH ALL PAYROLL TAX RETURNS FILED BY THE CHAMBER. DIRECT EXPENSES FOR THE FOUNDATION ARE CHARGED DIRECTLY. SHARED FACILITY COSTS, AS WELL AS ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF, ARE ALLOCATED BETWEEN THE ORGANIZATIONS BASED ON FTE. THESE COSTS, AND THE METHOD IN WHICH THEY ARE ALLOCATED ARE DEFINED IN A FORMAL COST SHARING AGREEMENT. THIS COST SHARING AGREEMENT HAS BEEN REVIEWED BY THE TAX DEPARTMENT OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM TO ENSURE THE AGREEMENT AND ALLOCATION METHOD ARE REASONABLE, ARE IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE, AND ARE APPLIED IN A CONSISTENT MANNER.
